member.name: IPersistStorage.HandsOffStorage
member.summary: Instructs the object to release all storage objects that have been passed to it by its container and to enter HandsOff mode.
member.returns: This method returns S_OK to indicate that the object has entered HandsOff mode successfully.

member.name: IPersistStorage.InitNew
member.param: An pointer to the new storage object to be initialized. The container creates a nested storage object in its storage object (see ). Then, the container calls the function to initialize the new storage object with the object class identifier (CLSID).

returns.para: This method can return the following values.

listheader.description: The object has already been initialized by a previous call to either the method or the method.
The storage object was not initialized due to a lack of memory.
The storage object was not initialized for some reason other than a lack of memory.

member.name: IPersistStorage.IsDirty
member.summary: Determines whether an object has changed since it was last saved to its current storage.
member.returns: This method returns S_OK to indicate that the object has changed. Otherwise, it returns S_FALSE.

member.name: IPersistStorage.Load
member.summary: Loads an object from its existing storage.
member.param: An pointer to the existing storage from which the object is to be loaded.

returns.para: This method can return the following values.

listheader.description: The object has already been initialized by a previous call to the method or the method.
The object was not loaded due to lack of memory.
The object was not loaded due to some reason other than a lack of memory.

member.name: IPersistStorage.Save
member.summary: Saves an object, and any nested objects that it contains, into the specified storage object. The object enters NoScribble mode.
member.param: An pointer to the storage into which the object is to be saved.

param.name: fSameAsLoad
param.para: Indicates whether the specified storage is the current one, which was passed to the object by one of the following calls: , , or .

This parameter is set to FALSE when performing a Save As or Save A Copy To operation or when performing a full save. In the latter case, this method saves to a temporary file, deletes the original file, and renames the temporary file.
This parameter is set to TRUE to perform a full save in a low-memory situation or to perform a fast incremental save in which only the dirty components are saved.

returns.para: This method can return the following values.

listheader.description: The object was not saved because of a lack of space on the disk.
The object could not be saved due to errors other than a lack of disk space.

member.name: IPersistStorage.SaveCompleted
member.summary: Notifies the object that it can write to its storage object. It does this by notifying the object that it can revert from NoScribble mode (in which it must not write to its storage object), to Normal mode (in which it can). The object enters NoScribble mode when it receives an call.
member.param: An pointer to the new storage object, if different from the storage object prior to saving. This pointer can be NULL if the current storage object does not change during the save operation. If the object is in HandsOff mode, this parameter must be non-NULL.

returns.para: This method can return the following values.

listheader.description: The object remained in HandsOff mode or NoScribble mode due to a lack of memory. Typically, this error occurs when the object is not able to open the necessary streams and storage objects in pStgNew.
The pStgNew parameter is not valid. Typically, this error occurs if pStgNew is NULL when the object is in HandsOff mode.
The object is in Normal mode, and there was no previous call to or .

member.name: IPersistStorage
member.summary: Enables a container application to pass a storage object to one of its contained objects and to load and save the storage object. This interface supports the structured storage model, in which each contained object has its own storage that is nested within the container's storage.
